page.title: 08TRAFFIC
page.content: Our names are Sian Hughes and Catrin Jones. Today ,17th July 1985, we went to consider the traffic problem in Trefnant. In the middle of the village is a crossroads where many main roads meet. We counted the number of vehicles passing in a two hour period, and this is what we counted: 247 cars 44 lorries 3 tractors 4 motorbikes 2 hearse 1 caravan 5 ambulances The number of ambulances is high because they use the roads to travel to the nearby hospital in St.Asaph, which is only a few miles from Trefnant. We asked some of the locals what they thought of living so near to the road, they sais that you get used to the noise and the traffic and it doesn't bother you at all.
